intro: Declieuxia chiococcoides var. opaca, commonly known as the Opaca sedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically dark green and slightly hairy. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the Cyperaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical structure makes it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
